oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Supplementary remarks of the presiding officer, Raymond B. Witt, Jr. at the school board meeting, 1955 November 15
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Witt, Raymond B., 1915-2000
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Raymond B. Witt's remarks delivered at a 1955 Chattanooga, Tennessee school board meeting, address public concerns over the landmark United States Supreme Court decision in Brown v. Board of Education to integrate public schools.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Brown v. Board of Education of Topeka; Segregation in education -- Law and legislation; Segregation in education -- Tennessee -- Chattanooga
Chattanooga (Tenn.). Board of Education
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:source: Chattanooga Board of Education Interracial Advisory Committee records, 1955-1956
Chattanooga Board of Education records and correspondence, 1953-1961
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:isPartOf: Raymond B. Witt Chattanooga Public Schools desegregation records
